sub_title: Ph.D. in Astrophysics | Applied R&D & Innovation (BLE, Edge AI)

home.description: I am a Ph.D. in Astrophysics based in Santiago, Chile, with experience spanning both academic research and applied R&D. My research background includes the interstellar medium in distant, gravitationally lensed dusty star-forming galaxies at high redshift (e.g., SPT-SMG sample) using multi-wavelength data and interferometry. From 2024 to September 2025, I worked as a Project Manager in an innovation company (iGo Technologies), leading projects that combine BLE-based positioning and machine learning to improve worker safety and operational efficiency in harsh environments such as mines and industrial facilities.
home.highlight: Bridging academia and industry: from extragalactic astronomy & interferometry to BLE positioning and edge AI for safety-critical environments.
fields: Applied R&D: BLE Positioning, Edge AI/ML

papers.abstract: My research focuses on the interstellar medium and star formation in distant, gravitationally lensed dusty star-forming galaxies. I use multi-wavelength datasets and interferometric observations (e.g., ALMA) to constrain gas, dust, and star formation properties and their evolution across cosmic time.

papers.title: BLE positioning + ML for harsh environments
papers.abstract: In industry, I led projects that integrate BLE beacons and mobile devices to provide accurate worker positioning where GPS and connectivity are limited. The work combines empirical testing, RF considerations, and ML pipelines for positioning models that can run on mobile devices (edge inference).
